inclusion.criterion: Male or female patients, 18 years of age or older.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Newly diagnosed patients with acromegaly, or previously untreated.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Presence of a pituitary tumor greater than 10 mm at greatest diameter (macroadenoma).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Lack of suppression of GH to less than 2.0 ng/mL using a regular GH RIA, or less than one ng/mL using a two-site immunoradiometric or chemiluminescent GH assay, after oral administration of 100 g of glucose.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: IGF-1 levels above the upper limits of normal (adjusted for age and gender).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Demonstrated tolerance to a test dose of s.c. Sandostatin Injection.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients who are able to provide written informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients demonstrating intolerance to a s.c. Sandostatin (octreotide acetate) test dose.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Female patients who are pregnant or lactating, or are of childbearing potential and not practicing a medically acceptable method of birth control.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 41-year-old man with acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. He has IGF-1 level of 4.5 ULN adjusted by sex and age.
